DOC.brief_summary: Measurement of RNFL thickness by OCT is at a cornerstone for the correct diagnosis and monitoring of progression of glaucomatous optic neuropathy. Spectral domain technology has enabled better reproducibility with better axial resolution in the measurement of RNFL thickness. A comparative study among Stratus, Cirrus and RT-View will enable clinicians to determine differences among various instruments.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Retinal Nerve Fiber Layer (RNFL) Thickness Measurements by Time-Domain and Spectral-Domain OCT In Glaucoma Patients
